issue.title: accounts.frame.io
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://accounts.frame.io/welcome?auth_callback=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.frame.io%2Fauth%2Fcallback&redirect_path=%2F](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Faccounts.frame.io%2Fwelcome%3Fauth_callback%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fapp.frame.io%252Fauth%252Fcallback%26redirect_path%3D%252F) ### Comment > I switched from using Brave brower to Edge today and I was all of the sudden unable to login to www.frame.io. after putting in my credentials, the page just reloads and never logs in. I opened an InPrivate tab and was able to log in just fine. I turned off all extensions and then one by one turned on the extensions and I was able to login fine until enabling Adguard. Once Adguard was enabled the page just reloads at login. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/do4cKxs.png)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/ZlV9ySI.png)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser extension v4.1.53 Browser: | EdgeChromium Stealth mode: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection Other extensions used: | 1password, bombomb, honey, raindrop.io, todoist for gmail, tubebuddy

comment.body:
The problem is that extensions for Firefox and Opera cannot download/update Javascript rules.
Please add this rule:
```adblock
facebook.com,facebookwkhpilnemxj7asaniu7vnjjbiltxjqhye3mhbshg7kx5tfyd.onion#%#!function(){var b=0,d=[];new MutationObserver(function(){document.querySelectorAll("div[data-pagelet^=\"FeedUnit\"]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"feed\"] > div:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"feed\"] > span:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div span > h3 ~ div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div h3~ div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"main\"] div[class] > #ssrb_feed_start ~ div > h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]),div[role=\"main\"] div > h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"])").forEach(function(e){Object.keys(e).forEach(function(a){if(a.includes("__reactEvents")||a.includes("__reactProps")){a=e[a];try{if(a.children?.props?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.feedEdge?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.children?.props?.feedEdge?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")){b++,e.style="display: none !important;";var f=e.querySelector("a[href][aria-label]:not([aria-hidden])");f&&(d.push(["Ad blocked based on property ["+b+"] -> "+f.ariaLabel]),console.table(d))}}catch(a){}}})})}).observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0})}();
```
to user rules.

You can also try to install AdGuard Extra - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra#how-to-install-adguard-extra
It also should blocks sponsored posts.

comment.body: @Alex-302 `ck.jp.ap.valuecommerce.com`, `atrrd.valuecommerce.com`, and `vcentry3.valuecommerce.com` can be unblocked on DNS in regard to web advertising. AFAIK `ad.jp.ap.valuecommerce.com` and `aplkp.valuecommerce.com` are used to deliver ads on the web, but I don't know much about mobile ads.

So should change to `-telemetry.officeapps.live.com^`?
In Safari also url blocking can block pages. But it is very rare case.

issue.title: Google invaild search result

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Dangerous site

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many websites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In Google search result with a Korean language query, there are some spam websites that its domain is changed frequently.


It seems that importing the following rules is best idea.

```adblock
/^https:\/\/[A-z0-9\.]*[A-z0-9]+\.[A-z]+\/\?u=[A-z0-9]{7}&o=[A-z0-9]{7}/$document
/^https:\/\/[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\/[A-z]+-robot\/\?pl=[A-z0-9-]{22}&sm=[A-z]+-robot&hash=[A-z0-9-]{22}&exp=[0-9]{10}/$document
/^https:\/\/[0-9]{9}\.[A-z0-9-]+\.[A-z]{2}\/[0-9]{6}\.html$/$document
```

Related issues:
 - https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues/598
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139667

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: I assume now `/^https:\/\/[A-z0-9\.]*[A-z0-9]+\.[A-z]+\/\?u=[A-z0-9]{7}&o=[A-z0-9]{7}/$document` part is mostly addressed by https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/372525846a2193efaf589752097fe1da170e4d4b - except the adopted regex uses lookahead `(?!www)`. It's just a safety measure to avoid potential FP and may possibly be removed. @Alex-302 How do you think?

issue.title: Google invaild search result

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.1.53

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Dangerous site

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Many websites

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

In Google search result with a Korean language query, there are some spam websites that its domain is changed frequently.


It seems that importing the following rules is best idea.

```adblock
/^https:\/\/[A-z0-9\.]*[A-z0-9]+\.[A-z]+\/\?u=[A-z0-9]{7}&o=[A-z0-9]{7}/$document
/^https:\/\/[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\.[A-z]+\/[A-z]+-robot\/\?pl=[A-z0-9-]{22}&sm=[A-z]+-robot&hash=[A-z0-9-]{22}&exp=[0-9]{10}/$document
/^https:\/\/[0-9]{9}\.[A-z0-9-]+\.[A-z]{2}\/[0-9]{6}\.html$/$document
```

Related issues:
 - https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues/598
 - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/139667

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I don't like common regexpes, so at least it should have more specfic regex part)

@piquark6046 What do you think?
